comments.raw_text: It currently takes a char*, changes that char* in place, and then returns it as well. Something like Unescape(const nsAString&, nsAString&) or at least Unescape(nsAString&) would be much nicer, IMO.
comments.creator: Ms2ger@gmail.com
comments.text: It currently takes a char*, changes that char* in place, and then returns it as well. Something like Unescape(const nsAString&, nsAString&) or at least Unescape(nsAString&) would be much nicer, IMO.
comments.author: Ms2ger@gmail.com

comments.creator: bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.raw_text:
Unescaping an nsAString is sort of rocket-science.

There's already an NS_UnescapeURL which works on an nsACString&.
comments.text:
